docs.lead_paragraph: Four years after George Bush took office proclaiming himself to be the "education President," he can point to few tangible accomplishments that have improved the nation's schools. But President Bush and his aides do claim credit for starting a movement called America 2000 that they say will force fundamental changes in American education. It has spawned local education reform drives like one here in Memphis and in more than 1,000 other communities across the country.

headline.main: Long Fight for Local Support Hampers Bush on Education
